item.title: Let's Talk Bitcoin LIVE! #303 The Title and the Token
item.description:
Let's Talk Bitcoin LIVE! #303 The Title and the Token

On Episode 303 On this special Live episode of Let's Talk Bitcoin!, Adam Levine and Pamela Morgan sit down with Ragnar Lifthrasir of the International Blockchain Real Estate Association and Chris Bates of the Bitland Ghana project at the D10E Conference which took place on July 20th, 2016 in San Francisco.

item.title: The Evolution of the Bitcoin Vending Machine
item.description:
The Evolution of the Bitcoin Vending Machine

A Cryptocurrency vending machine has been found at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT). Just recently MIT Media Lab's Ethan Zuckerman Also Read: DASH-Powered Soda Machine to Debut at Miami Bitcoin Conference tweeted to his followers about the campus' machine, which accepts bitcoin and is stocked with nothing but Soylent meal replacement drinks.

item.title: More Wallet Support Would Be Good For Ethereum Classic
item.description:
More Wallet Support Would Be Good For Ethereum Classic

Although Ethereum Classic has been around for some time now, many users are still looking for a wallet solution. The official Mist client is one option, which supports both ETH and ETC depending on whether users activate the hard fork. But when it comes to web wallets, the choices are very slim.

item.title: Judge Pooler's View of Bitcoin Leads to a Debate on Bitcoin's Status - NEWSBTC
item.description:
Judge Pooler's View of Bitcoin Leads to a Debate on Bitcoin's Status - NEWSBTC

Judge Pooler's recent decision to not consider bitcoin as a currency has sparked a debate among the digital currency community about the digital currency's status. Read more... READ MORE: Michell Espinoza Case: Bitcoin Can't Be Considered as Money What is Bitcoin?

item.title: How the Great Schism Can End Well for Ethereum Classic (Part 2 of 3)
item.description:
How the Great Schism Can End Well for Ethereum Classic (Part 2 of 3)

Ethereum Classic is dominating the cryptocurrency news cycle. After a slumber of some days following the Ethereum hard fork that refunded investors of the hacked DAO, the unforked and re-named Ethereum blockchain and its native token classic ether (ETC) surged.

item.title: Paymeabit Value Network Helps Users Monetize their Social Content - NEWSBTC
item.description:
Paymeabit Value Network Helps Users Monetize their Social Content - NEWSBTC

Paymeabit is an Italian startup that allows social media users monetize their content. Every action on the Paymeabit social platform earns the user a small fraction of bitcoin. Read more... The digital currency economy is gradually moving towards the user-generated online content market.

item.title: BTC/USD: Bitcoin Price Index Holds Steady as Market Searches for Direction
item.description:
BTC/USD: Bitcoin Price Index Holds Steady as Market Searches for Direction

The value of bitcoin was little changed on Saturday, as investors remained on the sidelines following the Federal Reserve's decision to keep interest rates on hold. The BTC/USD traded within a narrow range Saturday. It was last down 0.1% at $656.23, according to CoinDesk. The bitcoin market has received little action since the Federal Reserve's ...

item.title: The First Italian Bank Bailout Package Is Being Prepared
item.description:
The First Italian Bank Bailout Package Is Being Prepared

It is expected more European banks will follow suit of Italy's oldest bank and raise new capital. This means other countries will have to inject funds into the regions which are in financial trouble, and weaken their position at the same time. The Italian banking crisis has been on the radar of many people as of late.

item.title: Libertarian Presidential Candidate Would Consider Ross Ulbricht Pardon
item.description:
Libertarian Presidential Candidate Would Consider Ross Ulbricht Pardon

Libertarian presidential candidate Gary Johnson has said that he would consider granting pardons to several high-profile convicts of hacking and computer-related crimes such as Ross Ulbricht, Edward Snowden, and Chelsea Manning.

item.title: Philips Healthcare's Blockchain Lead is Leaving Next Month - CoinDesk
item.description:
Philips Healthcare's Blockchain Lead is Leaving Next Month - CoinDesk

The founder and head of Philips Blockchain Lab is leaving the healthcare giant effective 1st August for new opportunities in the blockchain sector. Arno Laeven, who led a 12-person internal team which investigated how blockchain tech could be applied to healthcare, said he will be departing for "new adventures" in the industry, but declined additional comment.
